text: Our main office lost internet connectivity at 8:03am. Multiple users are affected.
Thank you for reporting. Are all users affected, or only certain departments or locations?
It appears to be the entire main office. Remote users are not affected.
Understood. Is there any network equipment showing errors or alerts?
The core switch has a red status LED and the firewall is unreachable from our monitoring system.
Please check if the core switch is powered and if cables are securely connected. Any recent changes or maintenance?
No scheduled maintenance. The switch is powered but shows constant amber lights on all ports.
Amber lights may indicate a loop or broadcast storm. Any alarms or error logs from the switch console?
Console output shows repeated STP topology changes and high CPU usage.
This suggests a network loop. Were any new devices or cables added recently?
A new conference room switch was installed yesterday.
Please disconnect the new switch and observe if the core switch recovers.
Disconnected. The core switch status is now green and internet is restored.
Great. The new switch may have created a loop. Please check its configuration before reconnecting.
The new switch had both uplink ports connected to the core, causing a loop.
Recommend enabling Spanning Tree Protocol (STP) on all switches to prevent future loops.
STP is now enabled. Everything is stable. Thank you!
